meanings.sent1: The flincher jumped at the sudden noise.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the biggest flincher in our group.
meanings.sent3: The flincher always makes everyone laugh with their exaggerated reactions.
meanings.sent4: He was a flincher when it came to horror movies, always covering his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The little girl, a true flincher, would startle at the slightest touch.

meanings.definition: To flinch or show hesitation in the face of danger or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: Do not flincher when faced with challenges; face them head-on.
meanings.sent2: She tends to flincher when asked to speak in public.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to flincher before pouncing on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: He had to fight the urge to flincher as the roller coaster climbed higher.
meanings.sent5: The warrior's training helped him not to flincher in the heat of battle.
